page.title: 15St.Andrew's Church Medstead
page.content:
The church at Medstead was mentioned in the Domesday Book in 1086, which shows that part of it is Norman or earlier. It was enlarged in 1160, and further alterations were carried out in 1561 and 1645.
In 1845 the narrow Norman archway between the Nave and the Chancel was replaced with the current pointed one. Between 1851 and 1861 the West tower was demolished. The South Door was added because the low North Door knocked the top hats off yeoman farmers as they entered the church.
The oldest part of the church now existing is the North Arcade of the Nave, built in 1160.
/cont p16
